# Navigating the Decision Tree {.title-slide}

## Choosing the Right Visualization for Your Data

**A Practical Framework Based on Analytical Goals**

---

# The 3-Step Framework

## Your Roadmap for Visualization Selection

::: {.incremental}
1. **Identify Your Data Type**
   - What kind of data do you have? (Numeric, Categorical, Temporal, etc.)

2. **Define Your Analytical Goal**
   - What do you want to communicate? (Compare, Distribute, Show Relationships, etc.)

3. **Select the Appropriate Chart**
   - What visualization best achieves your goal?
:::

# The Seven Analytical Goals

## Color-Coded Framework

| Goal | Symbol | Question | Purpose |
|------|--------|----------|---------|
| **Distribution** | <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> | "What's the spread?" | Show data spread, shape, outliers |
| **Correlation** | <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> | "How do things relate?" | Show relationships between variables |
| **Ranking** | <span style="color: #A6D854;">â—</span> | "What's the order?" | Compare values in order |
| **Part of Whole** | <span style="color: #FB8072;">â—</span> | "What's the composition?" | Show proportions/percentages |
| **Evolution** | <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> | "How does it change over time?" | Track trends and changes |
| **Maps** | <span style="color: #BEBADA;">â—</span> | "Where is it located?" | Geographic/spatial distribution |
| **Flow** | <span style="color: #FCCDE5;">â—</span> | "How does it move?" | Movement, transitions, journeys |

# Color Legend: Chart-to-Goal Mapping

## Quick Reference - What Each Color Means

- <span style="color: #FDB462;">**â—**</span> **Gold/Yellow = Distribution** - Shows data spread, frequency, shape, outliers
- <span style="color: #80B1D3;">**â—**</span> **Blue = Correlation** - Shows relationships, associations between variables
- <span style="color: #A6D854;">**â—**</span> **Green = Ranking** - Shows order, comparison of values, top/bottom
- <span style="color: #FB8072;">**â—**</span> **Red/Salmon = Part of Whole** - Shows composition, proportions, percentages
- <span style="color: #80B1D3;">**â—**</span> **Light Blue = Evolution** - Shows trends, changes over time, trajectories
- <span style="color: #BEBADA;">**â—**</span> **Purple = Maps** - Shows geographic/spatial distribution, location-based data
- <span style="color: #FCCDE5;">**â—**</span> **Pink/Tan = Flow** - Shows movement, transitions, journeys, hierarchies

**Tip:** When you see a colored dot next to a chart name, it tells you what analytical goal that chart serves best!

# Know Your Data

## The 6 Data Type Categories

| Data Type | Definition | Examples |
|-----------|-----------|----------|
| **Numeric** | Continuous measurements | Age, weight, blood pressure, lab values |
| **Categoric** | Discrete categories/groups | Gender, disease status, treatment type |
| **Ordinal** | Ordered categories | Likert scale, tumor stages, severity levels |
| **Time Series** | Temporal/chronological data | Monthly incidence, patient vitals over time |
| **Relational** | Connections/networks | Patient pathways, disease networks |
| **Map** | Geographic/spatial data | Regional disease rates, location coordinates |

# SINGLE VARIABLE: Categoric Data

## <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> Distribution | <span style="color: #A6D854;">â—</span> Ranking | <span style="color: #FB8072;">â—</span> Part of Whole

### Chart Options:
- **Bar Chart** <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> (counts/frequencies)
- **Lollipop Chart** <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> (alternative to bar, especially for long lists)
- **Cleveland Dot Plot** <span style="color: #A6D854;">â—</span> (ranked comparison)
- **Pie Chart** <span style="color: #FB8072;">â—</span> (â‰¤5 categories only, part-to-whole)
- **Doughnut Chart** <span style="color: #FB8072;">â—</span> (like pie, better labels)
- **Circular Bar Plot** <span style="color: #A6D854;">â—</span> (aesthetic alternative)

### Healthcare Examples:
- Disease prevalence by state
- Hospitalization by insurance type
- Comorbidity frequency distribution

### Decision Guide:
- **Few categories (<5)** and need part-of-whole â†’ Pie/Doughnut
- **Few-moderate categories** â†’ Bar chart (horizontal if long names)
- **Many categories (>8)** â†’ Lollipop or Cleveland dot
- **Need ranking emphasis** â†’ Ordered bar or lollipop

# SINGLE VARIABLE: Ordinal Data

## <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> Distribution | <span style="color: #FB8072;">â—</span> Part of Whole (Ordered)

### Chart Options:
- **Ordered Bar Chart** <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> (maintain categorical order)
- **Ordered Dot Plot** <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span>
- **Cumulative Frequency Plot** <span style="color: #FB8072;">â—</span> (especially for Likert scales)
- **Frequency Polygon** <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> (smooth trend)

### Healthcare Examples:
- Patient satisfaction (Likert: 1=Very Unsatisfied to 5=Very Satisfied)
- Tumor stages frequency (Stage I â†’ II â†’ III â†’ IV)
- Pain severity distribution (None â†’ Mild â†’ Moderate â†’ Severe)
- Risk level counts (Low â†’ Medium â†’ High)

### Decision Guide:
- **Likert scales** â†’ Stacked ordered bar or cumulative frequency
- **Natural progression** (stages, severity) â†’ Maintain order on axis
- **Show accumulation** â†’ Cumulative frequency plot
- **Compare between groups** â†’ Grouped ordered bar

# SINGLE VARIABLE: Numeric Data

## <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> Distribution

### Chart Options:
- **Histogram** <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> (shows bin structure, distribution shape)
- **Density Plot** <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> (smooth, continuous estimate)
- **Boxplot** <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> (summary: median, quartiles, outliers)
- **Violin Plot** <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> (distribution + boxplot combined)
- **Dot/Strip Plot** <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> (individual points, best for small n)

### Healthcare Examples:
- Age distribution in cohort
- Blood pressure measurements in population
- Lab values (HbA1c, cholesterol, creatinine)
- Hospital length of stay

### Decision Guide:
| Scenario | Best Choice | Why |
|----------|------------|-----|
| **n < 20** | Dot/Strip plot | See every point |
| **n = 20-100** | Histogram + Boxplot | Balance detail & summary |
| **n > 100** | Density plot | Smooth, reduces noise |
| **Want outliers** | Boxplot | Shows extreme values clearly |
| **Want shape details** | Violin plot | Shows multimodality, skewness |

# SINGLE VARIABLE: Time Series

## <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> Evolution

### Chart Options:
- **Line Chart** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (standard for continuous time data)
- **Area Chart** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (emphasizes magnitude/volume)
- **Streamgraph** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (stacked area with flowing theme)

### Healthcare Examples:
- Disease incidence trends over years
- Hospital admission rates monthly
- COVID-19 case counts by week
- Patient vital signs during hospitalization

### Decision Guide:
- **Single series, continuous time** â†’ Line chart
- **Show cumulative volume** â†’ Area chart
- **Multiple series, show total** â†’ Stacked area
- **Sparse time points** â†’ Line chart with markers

# SINGLE VARIABLE: Spatial/Map Data

## <span style="color: #BEBADA;">â—</span> Maps

### Chart Options:
- **Choropleth Map** <span style="color: #BEBADA;">â—</span> (color-coded by region)
- **Bubble Map** <span style="color: #BEBADA;">â—</span> (circles sized by value)
- **Heat Map** <span style="color: #BEBADA;">â—</span> (geographic intensity)

### Healthcare Examples:
- Regional disease rates (e.g., TB incidence by state in India)
- Hospital bed density by district
- Maternal mortality ratios by region

### Decision Guide:
- **Show rate/percentage by region** â†’ Choropleth

- **Show intensity/density** â†’ Heat map
- **Specific point locations matter** â†’ Dot map

# BIVARIATE: Numeric Ã— Numeric

## <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> Correlation | <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> Distribution

### Chart Options:
- **Scatter Plot** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (relationship between two continuous variables)
- **Hexbin Plot** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (2D histogram for dense data)
- **2D Density Plot** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (contour or heatmap of overlapping points)
- **Bubble Plot** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (3rd variable via size or color)

### Healthcare Examples:
- Age vs BMI (body mass relationship)
- HbA1c vs Blood Glucose (glycemic control markers)
- Creatinine vs eGFR (kidney function)
- Systolic vs Diastolic Blood Pressure

### Decision Guide:
| Scenario | Best Choice |
|----------|------------|
| **Moderate sample, clear pattern** | Scatter plot |
| **Large n, lots of overplotting** | Hexbin or 2D density |
| **Want 3rd variable shown** | Bubble (size) or color gradient |
| **Focused region interest** | Zoomed scatter with annotations |

# BIVARIATE: Numeric Outcome Ã— Categoric Predictor

## <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> Distribution | <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> Correlation (Comparison)

### Chart Options:
- **Boxplot** <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> (median, quartiles, outliers by group)
- **Violin Plot** <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> (distribution shape by group)
- **Jittered Dot/Strip/Beeswarm Plot** <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> (individual points by group)
- **Bar Chart with Error Bars** <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> (mean/median Â± SD/IQR)
- **Cleveland Dot Plot** <span style="color: #A6D854;">â—</span> (ranked group means)

### Healthcare Examples:
- HbA1c levels across treatment arms
- BMI by disease status (healthy vs diabetic vs obese)
- Blood pressure by gender
- Hospital length of stay by admission type

### Decision Guide:
| Sample Size | Distribution Focus | Summary Focus |
|-------------|-------------------|---------------|
| **n < 30** | Dot/Strip + Boxplot | Not recommended |
| **n = 30-100** | Violin or Boxplot | Bar with error bars |
| **n > 100** | Violin plot | Density overlay + mean line |
| **Outliers matter** | Boxplot + jitter | Always show |
| **Group ranking focus** | Ranked dots | Lollipop chart |

# BIVARIATE: Categoric Outcome Ã— Numeric Predictor

## <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> Correlation (Probability)

### Chart Options:
- **Logistic Regression Curve** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (smooth probability line)
- **Density Overlay** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (stacked densities by category)
- **Grouped Histogram/Density** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (overlapping distributions)

### Healthcare Examples:
- Disease presence/absence across age ranges
- Treatment response (yes/no) by baseline score
- Adverse event (yes/no) by medication dose
- Mortality (yes/no) by APACHE score

### Visualization:
- X-axis: Numeric predictor (age, score, dose)
- Y-axis: Probability or proportion
- Two groups shown as overlapping curves or stacked

# BIVARIATE: Categoric Ã— Categoric

## <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> Distribution | <span style="color: #A6D854;">â—</span> Ranking | <span style="color: #FB8072;">â—</span> Part of Whole | <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> Correlation

### Chart Options:
- **Grouped Bar Chart** <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> (side-by-side comparison)
- **Dodged Bar Chart** <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> (similar to grouped)
- **Stacked Bar Chart** <span style="color: #FB8072;">â—</span> (shows totals + composition)
- **Stacked Bar (Proportional)** <span style="color: #FB8072;">â—</span> (percentage/100% stacked)
- **Mosaic Plot** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (area âˆ frequency, shows association)
- **Heatmap** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (color intensity for cell frequencies)

### Healthcare Examples:
- Gender vs Disease status (M/F vs HIV+/HIV-)
- Treatment arm vs Adverse event (Drug A/B vs AE Yes/No)
- Hospital site vs Patient outcome (Site 1-3 vs Recovered/Died)
- Risk level by comorbidity count

### Decision Guide:
| Goal | Best Chart |
|------|-----------|
| **Compare totals & subgroups** | Grouped bar |
| **Show composition per category** | Stacked bar |
| **Show percentages only** | Stacked bar (proportional) |
| **Detect association strength** | Mosaic or heatmap |
| **Many categories, dense** | Heatmap with color gradient |

# BIVARIATE: Ordinal Ã— Numeric

## <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> Distribution (Ordered)

### Chart Options:
- **Ordered Boxplot** <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> (boxplot by ordinal groups, maintaining order)
- **Ordered Violin Plot** <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> (violin by ordinal groups)
- **Ordered Jittered Points** <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> (points by group, groups ordered)

### Healthcare Examples:
- Medication efficacy vs dose level (Low/Medium/High)
- Lab value vs disease severity (Stage I-IV)
- Pain score vs treatment intensity (Mild/Moderate/Severe)
- Functional status vs age group (Young/Middle/Elderly)

### Key Point:
- Always maintain explicit ordering on axis
- Example: Severity I â†’ II â†’ III â†’ IV (not random order)

# BIVARIATE: Time Series Ã— Numeric

## <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> Evolution | <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> Correlation (Trend)

### Chart Options:
- **Line Chart** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (single series over time)
- **Multi-line Chart** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (multiple series overlay)
- **Area Chart** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (cumulative volume over time)
- **Stacked Area Chart** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (composition over time)
- **Connected Scatter** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (if sparse time points)

### Healthcare Examples:
- Disease incidence trends over years (single disease)
- Patient vital signs over hospital stay (temperature, BP, HR)
- Medication effectiveness over weeks (Drug A vs B)
- Mortality rates over decades by region

### Decision Guide:
- **Single series** â†’ Line chart
- **Few series (2-3) to compare** â†’ Multi-line chart
- **Many series, want to show total** â†’ Stacked area
- **Series showing parts of whole** â†’ Stacked area
- **Sparse measurements** â†’ Line with markers or connected scatter

# BIVARIATE: Time Series Ã— Categoric

## <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> Evolution (By Group) | <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> Correlation (Group Comparison)

### Chart Options:
- **Grouped Line Chart** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (separate lines for each group)
- **Faceted Line Chart** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (separate subplots per group)
- **Grouped Area Chart** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (stacked or overlapping)
- **Interaction Plot** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (lines intersecting showing interaction)
- **Ribbon Chart** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (flowing bands representing groups)

### Healthcare Examples:
- Mortality rate trends (gender comparison: M vs F)
- Hospital admission trends by institution (5-year follow-up)
- Drug effectiveness over time by treatment arm
- Complication rates by age group over study period

### Decision Guide:
- **Few groups (2-3)** â†’ Multi-line chart
- **Many groups (5+)** â†’ Faceted line plots
- **Want to show total + groups** â†’ Stacked area
- **Interaction patterns matter** â†’ Interaction plot (lines cross)
- **Space constraints** â†’ Faceting better than overlapping

# BIVARIATE: Ordinal Ã— Categoric

## <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> Distribution (Ordered) | <span style="color: #FB8072;">â—</span> Part of Whole (Ordered)

### Chart Options:
- **Ordered Grouped Bar Chart** <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> (bars by category, groups ordered)
- **Ordered Stacked Bar** <span style="color: #FB8072;">â—</span> (stacked, ordinal categories in order)
- **Faceted Ordered Bar** <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> (subplots maintaining order)

### Healthcare Examples:
- Patient satisfaction (Likert: 1-5) by hospital ward
- Pain severity (None/Mild/Moderate/Severe) by treatment type
- Risk level (Low/Med/High) by comorbidity count
- Functional status by treatment arm

### Key Point:
- Maintain ordinal ordering on one axis
- Example: Satisfaction scale always: 1 â†’ 2 â†’ 3 â†’ 4 â†’ 5

# MULTIVARIATE: Numeric Ã— Numeric Ã— Numeric

## 3+ Continuous Variables | <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> Correlation

### Chart Options:
- **Bubble Plot** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (x, y, size = 3rd; color/opacity = 4th)
- **Faceted Scatter** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (scatter by groups, multiple subplots)

### Healthcare Examples:
- Age vs BMI (size=cholesterol, color=treatment arm)
- HbA1c vs glucose (size=insulin, faceted by gender)

### Decision Guide:
- **3 variables** â†’ Bubble plot (x, y, size)
- **4 variables** â†’ Bubble + color
- **5+ variables** â†’ Multiple faceted plots (don't try to cram)

# MULTIVARIATE: Numeric Outcome Ã— Multiple Numeric Predictors

## <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> Correlation Matrix

### Chart Options:
- **Correlation Matrix** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (numeric table of coefficients)
- **Correlogram** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (heatmap with color intensity = correlation strength)

### Healthcare Examples:

### Visualization:
- Color intensity (warm = positive, cool = negative)
- Cell size may represent correlation strength
- Diagonal typically = 1.0 (variable with itself)

# MULTIVARIATE: Numeric Outcome Ã— Multiple Categoric Predictors

## <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> Distribution (Faceted) | <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> Correlation (Interaction)

### Chart Options:
- **Faceted Boxplot/Violin** <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> (boxplot per group, subplots for 3rd variable)
- **Interaction Plot** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (lines connecting means by two factors)
- **Faceted Scatter + regression lines** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (by groups)

### Healthcare Examples:
- HbA1c by treatment type, faceted by gender (4 subplots: 2 treat Ã— 2 gender)
- Lab values by disease status, colored by age group
- Drug efficacy by dose level, faceted by patient comorbidity

### Visualization Strategy:
- Primary grouping on axis
- Secondary grouping via facets or colors
- Show interactions: do lines cross? Do patterns differ?

# MULTIVARIATE: Time Series Ã— Multiple Variables

## <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> Evolution (Advanced) | <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> Distribution (Temporal)

### Chart Options:
- **Multi-line Chart with Faceting** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (separate subplots per group)
- **Ridgeline Plot** <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> (distribution by group, stacked vertically)

- Disease incidence over years, separate lines by region (5 regions)
- Patient vitals during admission, faceted by treatment arm
- Hospital census by time, colored by department

### Decision Guide:
- **Multiple time series + groups** â†’ Faceted multi-line

- **Show change from start to end** â†’ Slope chart

# MULTIVARIATE: Complex Categorical (3+ Categoric)

## <span style="color: #FCCDE5;">â—</span> Flow | <span style="color: #FB8072;">â—</span> Part of Whole (Hierarchical)

### Chart Options:
- **Sankey Diagram** <span style="color: #FCCDE5;">â—</span> (flow from one category to another)
- **Alluvial Diagram** <span style="color: #FCCDE5;">â—</span> (similar to Sankey, broader flows)

### Healthcare Examples:
- **Sankey:** Patient flow (admission â†’ diagnostic â†’ treatment â†’ discharge)
- **Alluvial:** Disease progression stages (diagnosis â†’ worsening/improvement â†’ outcome)
- **Treemap:** Hospital structure (Region â†’ Hospital â†’ Department â†’ Ward)
- **Sunburst:** Disease classification (Category â†’ Subcategory â†’ Specific condition)

### Decision Guide:
- **Flow/transition/journey** â†’ Sankey or Alluvial
- **Nested hierarchy/parts** â†’ Treemap or Sunburst

# MULTIVARIATE: Relational/Network Data

## <span style="color: #FCCDE5;">â—</span> Flow | <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> Correlation (Connections)

### Chart Options:
- **Sankey Diagram** <span style="color: #FCCDE5;">â—</span> (directional flows between nodes)
- **Chord Diagram** <span style="color: #FCCDE5;">â—</span> (bi-directional relationships, circular)
- **Network Graph** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (nodes + edges, force-directed layout)
- **Arc Diagram** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> (nodes in line, arcs show connections)

### Healthcare Examples:
- **Sankey:** Patient journeys through clinic system
- **Chord:** Disease co-occurrence patterns (patient network)
- **Network:** Hospital referral patterns (which hospitals refer to which)
- **Arc:** Comorbidity networks (which diseases co-occur)

### Visualization:
- Nodes = entities (patients, diseases, hospitals)
- Edges/arcs/flows = relationships (referral, co-occurrence)

# MULTIVARIATE: Hierarchical Data (4+ Levels)

## <span style="color: #FB8072;">â—</span> Part of Whole | <span style="color: #FCCDE5;">â—</span> Flow

- **Treemap** <span style="color: #FB8072;">â—</span> (nested rectangles, size âˆ value)

### Healthcare Examples:
- **Treemap:** Hospital admissions by Region â†’ State â†’ Hospital â†’ Department (size = admission count)
- **Sunburst:** Disease classification by Category â†’ Subcategory â†’ Specific condition â†’ ICD code
- **Hierarchical Edge Bundling:** Referral patterns between hospitals at different levels

### Decision Guide:
- **Static hierarchy focus** â†’ Treemap
- **Want circular aesthetic** â†’ Sunburst
- **Complex relationships in hierarchy** â†’ Hierarchical edge bundling

# SPECIALIZED: Waterfall & Funnel Charts

## <span style="color: #FCCDE5;">â—</span> Flow | <span style="color: #FB8072;">â—</span> Part of Whole

### Waterfall Chart
- Shows cumulative effect of sequential positive/negative values
- **Healthcare Example:** Patient survival from enrollment â†’ screening loss â†’ randomization â†’ completion
  - Start: 1000 enrolled
  - Drop: -50 screening failures
  - Drop: -30 withdrawn consent
  - End: 920 completed
  
### Funnel Chart
- Stages in a process, showing attrition at each step
- **Healthcare Example:** Hospital admission pipeline
  - Emergency triage: 500
  - Admitted: 400 (20% filtered out)
  - Discharged: 350 (12.5% transferred)
  - Readmitted: 30 (8.6% recurrent)

---

# SPECIALIZED: Advanced Temporal Visualizations

## <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> Evolution (Advanced) | <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> Distribution (Temporal)

### Streamgraph
- Stacked area with flowing, organic theme
- **Example:** Emergency admissions over time, stacked by department
  - Total volume trends visible + department composition

### Calendar Heatmap
- Daily/weekly patterns across entire year
- **Example:** Hospital occupancy by day of week
  - Darker = higher occupancy
  - Pattern reveals peak days/seasons

### Frequency Polygon
- Line connecting histogram bins
- **Example:** Age distribution comparison between cohorts
  - Multiple overlaid frequency polygons

---

# SPECIALIZED: Text & Network Specialized

## <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> Distribution (Text) | <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> Correlation (Networks)

### Word Cloud
- Text frequency visualization, size = occurrence
- **Limitation:** More visual impact than analytic precision
- **Healthcare Use:** Patient feedback themes, common symptoms

### Arc Diagram
- Network relationships with improved readability over hairball graphs
- **Example:** Disease comorbidity network, cleaner than typical network graph

### Hierarchical Edge Bundling
- Complex relationship networks with hierarchy
- **Example:** Referral patterns between hospitals (different organizational levels)

# CASE STUDY 1: Real-World Application

## Scenario: "Quarterly revenue by product category over 2 years"

### Step 1: Identify Data Type
- **Time component:** Quarterly (Time Series)
- **Product component:** Multiple categories (Categoric)
- **Revenue component:** Continuous (Numeric)
- **Combined:** Time Series + Categoric + Numeric

### Step 2: Define Analytical Goal
- **Primary:** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> Evolution (how revenue changes over time)
- **Secondary:** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> Correlation (how categories compare)

### Step 3: Chart Options
| Option | Chart Type | Pros | Cons |
|--------|-----------|------|------|
| A | Multi-line chart <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> | Clear trend per product | Can be cluttered if >5 products |
| B | Stacked area <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> | Show total + composition | Hard to compare individual products |
| C | Faceted line charts <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> | Each product clear | Uses more space |
| D | Grouped bar chart <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> | Periodic view (snapshot) | Less sense of continuous trend |

# CASE STUDY 2: Healthcare Example

## Scenario: "HbA1c levels across three treatment arms over 12 months"

### Step 1: Identify Data Type
- **Time component:** Baseline, 6mo, 12mo (Time Series - discrete)
- **Group component:** 3 treatment arms (Categoric)
- **Outcome component:** HbA1c values (Numeric)
- **Combined:** Time Series + Categoric + Numeric

### Step 2: Define Analytical Goal
- **Primary:** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> Evolution (trajectories over follow-up)
- **Secondary:** <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> Correlation (do arms differ?)
- **Tertiary:** <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> Distribution (spread within each arm at each timepoint)

### Step 3: Chart Options
| Option | Chart Type | Visualization |
|--------|-----------|---------------|
| A | Multi-line Â± CI <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> | One line per arm, shaded confidence bands |
| B | Faceted violin plots <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> | 3 subplots (one per arm), violin at each timepoint |
| C | Spaghetti plot <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> | Individual patient trajectories, color-coded by arm |
| D | Interaction plot <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> | Means connected by lines, x-axis = timepoint |

# CASE STUDY 3: Multi-Dimensional Complexity

## Scenario: "Top 10 competitors' market share over 5 years by region"

### Step 1: Identify Data Type
- **Time:** Years (Time Series)
- **Competitors:** 10 categories (Categoric)
- **Regions:** Multiple regions (Categoric)
- **Market share:** Percentage (Numeric)
- **Dimensions:** 4 (too many for single plot!)

### Step 2: Define Analytical Goal
- <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> Evolution (trends over time)
- <span style="color: #A6D854;">â—</span> Ranking (who's leading?)
- <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> Correlation (how do regions differ?)
- <span style="color: #FB8072;">â—</span> Composition (what % of total?)

### Step 3: Chart Options
| Option | Approach |
|--------|----------|
| **A** | Stacked area per region (faceted: 3-5 subplots) <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> <span style="color: #FB8072;">â—</span> |
| **B** | Grouped multi-line (each region = different color) <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> |
| **C** | Animated bar chart (top 10 race by region) <span style="color: #A6D854;">â—</span> <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> |
| **D** | Interactive dashboard (toggle region) <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span> |

### Decision:
- **Best static option:** Faceted stacked area (shows time, composition, region comparison)
- **Best interactive:** Animated bar or dashboard

# Common Pitfalls to Avoid

## âŒ What NOT to Do

### âŒ Pie charts with 10+ categories
- **Why?** Human perception fails with small angles
- **Solution:** Use bar chart <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span>, lollipop <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span>, or split into multiple pies

### âŒ 3D charts
- **Why?** Perspective distorts data perception (3D cone/pyramid/sphere)
- **Solution:** Stick to 2D representations

### âŒ Dual-axis charts
- **Why?** Can mislead by manipulating axis scales
- **Solution:** Use faceting or separate plots instead

### âŒ Wrong color coding
- **Why?** Color should reinforce analytical goal (not random aesthetic)
- **Solution:** Sequential colors for magnitude, categorical colors for groups

### âŒ Overplotting (overlapping points)
- **Why?** Can't see density or exact position
- **Solution:** Use transparency (alpha), jitter, hexbin <span style="color: #80B1D3;">â—</span>, or density plots <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span>

### âŒ Stacked bars for detailed comparison
- **Why?** Only first and last categories are easy to compare
- **Solution:** Use grouped bar <span style="color: #FDB462;">â—</span> or faceting for detailed comparison

### âŒ Too many dimensions on one plot
- **Why?** Cognitive overload, hard to extract insight
- **Solution:** Split into multiple focused visualizations
